pages.text: Now that you've gotten metal, you'll be able to fashion logs into more useful things, like planks! First, you need to $(l:basic_smithing/casting)cast$() or $(l:basic_smithing/anvil)work$() a saw. It's mostly used in crafting, but it'll cut trees down if you want it to.

pages.title: Sawing lumber
pages.text: The first thing you'll need to do is saw your logs into lumber.

pages.title: Planks
pages.text: Lumber can be made into planks. These blocks don't have gravity! Yay.

pages.title: Oops!
pages.text: You can make your planks turn back into lumber.

pages.title: Workbench
pages.text: Now you can craft the big stuff.

pages.title: Tool Rack
pages.text: You'll want to hang this on your wall to keep all your tools together.

pages.title: Boat
pages.text: These work much better than they did in 1.7.10. You can actually get places now!

pages.title: Bookshelf
pages.text: These are just for decoration in TFC, but you can still make them.

pages.title: Chest
pages.text: Finally, some storage! Careful though, you can't put logs in it.

pages.title: Door
pages.text: You get two! Isn't that nice?

pages.title: Fence Gate
pages.text: Lets you check on the animals.
Other things like slabs, stairs, and buttons are as you'd expect! There's also a few other new TFC things, like $(l:processes/barrels)barrels$(), that we'll cover soon.
